data.title: Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL Station near Putrajaya Sentral MRT Station
data.meta_description: Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL Station, the ERL station for KLIA Transit at Putrajaya / Cyberjaya area and connection point to MRT Putrajaya Line
data.text:
Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station is one of the ERL stations for the KLIA Transit train and it is located within the Western Transport Terminal (WTT) in Precinct 7 of Putrajaya.

The following picture shows the aerial view of the ERL station located at the bottom, the park-and-ride facility on the right, and the bus and taxi hub on the left section.

The Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station is an integrated part of the complex which is known as Putrajaya Sentral.

This Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station was opened in 2002 with and it operates with 2 island platforms and 4 tracks.

The commuters at the Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERT station can connect to the Putrajaya Sentral MRT station on the MRT Putrajaya Line using the pedestrian walkway.

The MRT Putrajaya Line accommodates travel from Putrajaya to Cyberjaya, spanning densely populated areas such as Seri Kembangan, Kuchai Lama, Tun Razak Exchange, KLCC, Jalan Tun Razak, Jalan Jalan Sultan Azlan Shah, Jalan Ipoh, Batu, Keponjg, Sri Damanasara to Kwasa Damansara, a new township development in northwest Kuala Lumpur, serving a a corridor with a population of around 2 million people.

Stations for KLIA Transit KT3 Putrajaya & Cyberjaya PY41 Putrajaya Sentral

★ Read more about the MRT Putrajaya Line

Using the KLIA Transit ERL train, the ride will take 16 minutes from this station to the Kuala Lumpur International Airport Terminal 1 (KLIA terminal) and 20 minutes to the Kuala Lumpur International Airport Terminal 2 (klia2 terminal).

Stations for KLIA Transit KT1 KE1 KL Sentral KJ15 KL Sentral MR1 KL Sentral KA01 KS01 KL Sentral KG15 Muzium Negara KT2 Bandar Tasik Selatan SP15 Bandar Tasik Selatan KB04 Bandar Tasik Selatan KT3 Putrajaya & Cyberjaya PY41 Putrajaya Sentral KT4 Salak Tinggi KT5 KE2 KLIA KT6 KE3 klia2

At the Putrajaya Sentral, the Park-and-ride facilities are available to integrate the public transport system with private car use near the station.

The taxi centre and the bus hub provides transportation services to the commuters living near the Putrajaya & Cyberjaya areas.

Location of Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL Station

The Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station is located within the Western Transport Terminal (WTT) in Precinct 7. It’s an important component for the build-up of Putrajaya Sentral.

Putrajaya Sentral also comprises other multimodal transport services apart from the ERL & MRT stations, which includes a taxi centre, and a bus hub (currently utilised by RapidKL and Nadi Putra buses) that has city buses serving Putrajaya, express buses serving the city and scheduled intercity buses.

Due to the closeness of the these two cities, both residents in Putrajaya and Cyberjaya share the same station which is located in Putrajaya Sentral.

The ticketing counter and the ticket vending machines are available at the concourse.

After collecting the ticket, the commuters will enter the station through the fare gates and walk down to the boarding platforms.

The boarding platform 2 is for the KLIA Transit‘s service route from this ERL station to KT1 KL Sentral ERL station, with a quick stop at KT2 Bandar Tasik Selatan ERL station.

The boarding platform 3 is for the KLIA Transit‘s service route from this ERL station to KT6 klia2 ERL station, with a quick stop at KT4 Salak Tinggi ERL station and KT5 KLIA ERL station.

Trave time and fare

The Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station, hosted within the Putrajaya Sentral, is the KLIA Transit ERL station between the Bandar Tasik Selatan ERL station and the Salak Tinggi ERL station.

★ On the klia2 to KL Sentral route, the first KLIA Transit train from Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station starts at 5:38am and the last train will depart at 00:50am. Review klia2 to KL Sentral train schedule.

★ On the KL Sentral to klia2 route, the first KLIA Transit train from Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station starts at 5:22am and the last train will depart at 00:22am. Review KL Sentral to klia2 train schedule.

The KLIA Transit train performs a stop to pick up and drop off passengers at the following ERL stations.

Stations for KLIA Transit KT6 KE3 klia2 KT5 KE2 KLIA KT4 Salak Tinggi KT3 Putrajaya & Cyberjaya PY41 Putrajaya Sentral KT2 Bandar Tasik Selatan SP15 Bandar Tasik Selatan KB04 Bandar Tasik Selatan KT1 KE1 KL Sentral KJ15 KL Sentral MR1 KL Sentral KA01 KS01 KL Sentral KG15 Muzium Negara

Using the KLIA Transit train from this ERL station, the following are the time and train fare to other ERL stations.

KLIA Transit Fare & Duration From Putrajaya & Cyberjaya Station → klia2 20 mins

RM9.40 (Adult) / RM4.20 (Child) → KLIA 16 mins

RM9.40 (Adult) / RM4.20 (Child) → Salak Tinggi 9 mins

RM4.70 (Adult) / RM2.10 (Child) → Bandar Tasik Selatan 12 mins

RM8.00 (Adult) / RM3.60 (Child) → KL Sentral 19 mins

RM14.00 (Adult) / RM6.30 (Child)

Using the KLIA Transit? Try this Free Navigation Tool to check train routes and discover Klang Valley Integrated Transit System.

The ticketing counter and the ticket vending machines are available at the concourse for ticket purchase.

The ticket fare from this ERL station to the KLIA and klia2 terminals is RM9.40 for adult and RM4.20 for child.

Parking at Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL Station

The Putrajaya Sentral provides indoor and outdoor parking facility for commuters. This park-and-ride facility is managed by Perbadanan Putrajaya.

As normally is the case at most managed parking lots, car owners park their vehicles at their own risks.

Car Park Rates

Days Day Shift

6:00am – 12:00am Night Shift

12:00am – 6:00am 1 – 5 days RM2 / shift RM4 / shift 6 – 10 days RM2 / shift RM4 / shift 10 – 14 days RM2 / shift RM4 / shift New rates effective from January 2016. Maximum parking period is 14 days. Parking charges subjected to changes. Please check with Perbadanan Putrajaya for further details and terms & conditions.

The ERL company is not responsible for any damage to the parked vehicles or theft.

The security within and around the Putrajaya Sentral is under the jurisdiction of Perbadanan Putrajaya.

The commuters are reminded not to leave valuable items in their cars while using the parking the facilities at this premise.

The parking rate is RM2.00 from 6:00am to 12:00am and RM4.00 from 12:00am to 6:00am.

Transport Hub

The Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL station comprises multimodal transports which are the KLIA Transit station, taxi centre and a bus hub (currently RapidKL bus and Nadi Putra bus hub).

There are Feeder Buses servicing the Putrajaya & Cyberjaya station.

The Nadi Putra feeder service which currently covers Putrajaya city and Cyberjaya’s Persiaran Multimedia is owned by Perbadanan Putrajaya.

The Nadi Putra Feeder Service Bus number 300 serving Putrajaya from KLIA Transit Station at Western Transport Terminal.

Buses Servicing Putrajaya Sentral

RapidKL Bus U429 (Putrajaya Sentral – Cyberjaya Transport Terminal / CTT)

RapidKL Bus U43 (Putrajaya Sentral – Puchong – Bandar Utama)

Nadi Putra J02

Nadi Putra J05

There are feeder buses that run from the Putrajaya Sentral to rest of Putrajaya and Cyberjaya.

Commuters are advised to purchase the bus ticket at the ticketing counters near the bus hub.

For inquiry and assistance, please approach the information counter at the bus hub and check with the officer in charge.

Pictures of ERL station

The following are some pictures of the Putrajaya & Cyberjaya ERL Station and its surrounding for your review.

Commuters will enter the station through the fare gates, and then use the elevator or the staircase to go down to the boarding platforms.

Using the KLIA Transit train, the ride from this station to the KLIA terminal will take 16 minutes and 20 minutes to the klia2 terminal.

The ticket fare from this ERL station to the KLIA and klia2 terminals is RM9.40 for adult and RM4.20 for child.
